key.name: show-indicator
key.summary: Show Multi Monitors indicator on Top Panel.
key.description: Add or remove Multi Monitors indicator from Top Panel.

key.name: show-panel
key.description: Add or remove Panel from additional monitors.

key.name: show-activities
key.description: Change visibility of Activities-Button on additional monitors.

key.name: show-app-menu
key.description: Change visibility of AppMenu-Button on additional monitors.

key.name: show-date-time
key.description: Change visibility of DateTime-Button on additional monitors.

key.name: thumbnails-slider-position
key.description: Select position of Thumbnails-Slider on additional monitors.

key.name: available-indicators
key.description: A list of indicators that are available for transfer. For internal use only.

key.name: transfer-indicators
key.summary: A list of indicators for transfer.
key.description: A list of indicators selected for transfer to additional Panel.

key.name: exclude-indicators
key.summary: A list of indicators to exclude from transfer.
key.description: Indicators in this list will never be transferred to additional panels, even if they appear in available-indicators. Common values include 'fildem-indicator' for Fildem menu.

key.name: enable-blur-my-shell
key.description: Automatically register secondary panels with Blur my Shell extension for blur effects.

key.name: screenshot-on-all-monitors
key.summary: Show screenshot tools on all monitors.
key.description: When enabled, the screenshot UI tools will be shown on all monitors simultaneously. When disabled, they appear only on the monitor where the cursor is.

key.name: force-workspaces-on-all-displays
key.description: When enabled, the extension forces GNOME's workspace setting to span all displays. Disabling this may affect the workspaces thumbnail slider on secondary monitors.

key.name: show-overview-on-extended-monitors
key.summary: Show App Grid and Search on extended monitors.
key.description: When enabled, the custom overview (App Grid and Search) is shown on extended monitors. Disabling this completely hides the overview from secondary displays.
